description: Attaches a Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate to your load balancer. TLS is just an updated, more secure version of Secure Socket Layer (SSL). Once you create and validate your certificate, you can attach it to your load balancer. You can also use this API to rotate the certificates on your account. Use the AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate action with the non-attached certificate, and it will replace the existing one and become the attached certificate. The AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate operation supports tag-based access control via resource tags applied to the resource identified by load balancer name. For more information, see the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

parameters.name: loadBalancerName
parameters.description: The name of the load balancer to which you want to associate the SSL/TLS certificate.

parameters.name: certificateName
parameters.description: The name of your SSL/TLS certificate.

nested_items.name: operations
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the resources affected by the request.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the operation was initialized ( 1479816991.349).

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone. Follows the format us-east-2a (case-sensitive).

nested_items.name: regionName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region name.

nested_items.name: isTerminal
nested_items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the operation is terminal.

nested_items.name: statusChangedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the status was changed ( 1479816991.349).
